instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message:
I got this MBP 17 with board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
No video, and chime each 2 seg. I removed the GPU 0084 and chime one time and mouse is on. I put 0005, chime one time but still black screen. Should I add/remove some resistor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: 005 should always give an image. Check PCIE lines and caps. What date code chip is this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: It is 1720. I already put 10 of them and all works ok and pass benchmark test and stress gpu test. PCIE caps what you mean?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: A fake GPU will work fine for 6 months. Where did you buy these?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: I repaired Apple replacment board with 0005 datacode +16. Original GPU put in by Apple works 2 years. I think NEW chips are also fake.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: Sure Apple had brand new 2016 chips for their repairs. The stuff on Ali is all fake, you can believe me or not it does not change anything. If you want a real chip ask SEE IC they are one of the only few that will sell the real deal if you ask about it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: Got another 2914 boards and I replaced 0084 with 0005. Now I have image with lines. Should I move/add some resistors?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: Why don't you get some 0810001 chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
threads.message: The solution is to put 0001 or it should works with 0005?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 0084
